info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 19 at 2:12PM MDT until April 19 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... South central Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 315 PM MDT.
* At 211 PM MDT, a dust plume was over East El Paso, moving east at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Satellite imagery.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 61.
Locations impacted include... Tornillo, Homestead Meadows, Vinton, Agua Dulce, Biggs Field, Dairyland, Indian Cliffs Ranch, East El Paso, Franklin Mountains State Park, West El Paso, Canutillo, Fabens, Westway, Fort Bliss, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Clint, Butterfield, Mission Valley, and Hueco Mountain Estates.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; El Paso, TX
